name: Backend Migration PRD - PyTorch First
description: PyTorch-first migration prioritizing GPU-ready physics simulation
goals: Batched physics simulation in PyTorch (CPU/GPU agnostic)
100+ creatures simulated in <1 second on CPU
1000+ creatures in <1 second on A100 GPU
Full feature parity with TypeScript frontend

phases.name: PyTorch Physics Core
phases.description: Batched spring physics simulation in PyTorch tensors - the foundation for everything

items.name: Create tensor data structures
items.details: Design batched tensors for creatures: positions [B, max_nodes, 3], velocities [B, max_nodes, 3], masses [B, max_nodes], node_mask [B, max_nodes], spring connections [B, max_muscles, 2], spring params [B, max_muscles, 6]

items.name: Implement batched spring forces
items.details: Vectorized spring force calculation: F = -k(|x_b - x_a| - rest_length) * direction. Handle variable rest lengths for oscillation.

items.name: Implement gravity and ground collision
items.details: Batched gravity (simple), ground collision with friction and restitution. All creatures processed in parallel.

items.name: Implement muscle oscillation
items.details: Time-varying rest length: rest_length * (1 - amplitude * sin(freq * t + phase)). Batch across all muscles of all creatures.

items.name: Implement physics integration loop
items.details: Euler or Verlet integration. Run N timesteps, accumulate forces, update positions/velocities. Single kernel call per timestep.

items.name: Add pellet collision detection
items.details: Batched distance check between creature COMs and pellets. Track collection per creature.

items.name: Implement fitness calculation
items.details: Batched fitness: pellet points + progress + net displacement + distance traveled - penalties. All configurable weights.

items.name: Add disqualification detection
items.details: Detect NaN positions, physics explosions (position > threshold), frequency violations. Mark creatures as disqualified.

phases.name: PyTorch Neural Network
phases.description: Batched neural network forward pass for creature control

items.name: Create batched NN architecture
items.details: BatchedNeuralNetwork class using einsum for batched forward pass. Each creature has own weights stored as tensors. Supports tanh/relu/sigmoid activations.

items.name: Implement sensor input gathering
items.details: Batched computation of pellet_direction, velocity, distance. Pure mode (7 inputs) vs hybrid mode (8 inputs with time phase). gather_sensor_inputs function.

items.name: Integrate NN with physics loop
items.details: simulate_with_neural function integrates NN with physics. Pure mode: NN controls directly (contraction = nn_output * amplitude). Hybrid: NN modulates oscillator (nn_modulation = 0.5 + (nn_output + 1) * 0.5).

items.name: Add efficiency penalty tracking
items.details: physics_step_neural returns total_activation = sum(|nn_output|) for valid muscles. Accumulated over simulation for efficiency penalty.

items.name: Tune physics parameters

items.name: Benchmark CPU performance

notes.physics_approach: Custom spring physics in PyTorch tensors. Not using PyBullet because we need batched simulation across 1000+ creatures, which requires custom tensor ops.
notes.cpu_gpu_agnostic: All code uses torch tensors. Device selection at runtime: cuda if available, else cpu. Same code path.
notes.why_not_pybullet: PyBullet simulates one world at a time. We need to simulate 1000 creatures in parallel. Custom tensor physics allows this.
notes.accuracy_tradeoff: Our spring physics won't be identical to Cannon-ES, but for evolution it doesn't matter - creatures will adapt to whatever physics we use.
